# Visit

## Oskaloosa   
Art Center  
& Gallery

Located in the heart of downtown, the Oskaloosa Art Center and Gallery is dedicated to supporting the talent of our local artists. Whether it’s painting, sculpture, photography, or mixed media, the gallery provides a space for artists to connect, inspire, and showcase their pieces.

[ Learn More ](https://faceofmahaska.com/gallery-exhibit/)

[ Learn More ](https://faceofmahaska.com/?page_id=94)

## COOP GALLERY​

We can all use a little extra color in our lives. Show your support for local artists by visiting the Co-Op Gallery at the Oskaloosa Art Center. Our cooperative gallery features works for sale created by local, Mahaska County, artists.

[ Learn More ](https://faceofmahaska.com/coop-gallery/)

Learn More

## MURAL &   
SCULPTURE TOURS​

Adding pizzaz to historic Oslaoosa, the Mural and Sculpture tours draw residents and visitors to locations, which are both aesthetically and commercially interesting. Making Oskaloosa not only an attractive tourist destination, and a better place to live, work and play.

## Creating Art.   
Building Community.

## INTRODUCING... OUR NEW ART CENTER DIRECTOR!

Hello, everyone! My name is Nicole Pitts and I am honored to step into the role of Director of Oskaloosa Art Center and Studios. After graduating from Grand View University in 2014 with a degree in Art Education, I spent the next twelve years teaching visual arts to students across all grade levels, K–12. I loved helping students find inspiration, grow through both success and failure, and rise beyond their own expectations. I also enjoyed making connections to other content areas—particularly reading, science, history, and culture—to help students engage more deeply with the world around them.

In 2019, I earned my Master of Science in Education from Drake University, further strengthening my approach to creating engaging and authentic learning experiences for students of all ages. Alongside my time in education, I’ve spent many years working as a freelance artist and graphic designer. You may have seen my large murals featured during the Tulip Time Festival in Pella, or the conductor paintings on the metal facade while strolling the historic Trolley alleyway in Oskaloosa.

My personal artwork is often inspired by a desire to bring people together through shared experiences and to uplift others through visual storytelling and connection.
